Activity: Log in, check emails and read any responses from yesterday's email.

Continue root cause analysis for the first identified data quality issue (e.g., incomplete patient address data). Interview relevant staff (e.g., Medical Records Specialist, Registered Nurse) who interact with the data.
Document the interview findings, update the list of potential causes, and refine the hypotheses.
Start testing hypotheses related to the first data quality issue. Review system configurations, data validation rules, and error handling mechanisms.
Analyze test results and determine if the hypotheses are supported by the data. Document the findings and conclusions.
Based on the findings, identify the root cause(s) for the first data quality issue. Document the root cause(s) and provide supporting evidence.

Develop recommendations to address the root cause(s). This may include training programs, system modifications, workflow changes, or data definition updates. Send email to @ehrdev-1 and @ehrdev-2 about system modification.
Start working on root cause analysis for the second identified data quality issue (e.g., inconsistent coding practices). Gather relevant data and documentation.
Document the initial findings, potential causes, and hypotheses for the second data quality issue.
Prepare for tomorrow's work, review notes and set priorities.
